brief_summary.textblock:
Currently, office visits at general practitioners is free of charge for patients. However,
      public commissions and the Danish Economic Council have suggested to implement user charges
      for services that currently is free of charge. The aim of this study is to examine the
      consequences of introducing user charges for general practitioner services. Data for the
      project will be collected from patients who have an appointment with a general practitioner.
      Patients will be asked whether they are willing to pay a specified amount for the
      consultation that they have scheduled. After the consultation, the GP register diagnoses.

clinical_study.brief_title: User Charges for General Practitioner Services in Denmark

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with an appointment for a visit in a general practitioner clinic

          -  Reads and understand Danish

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

study_pop.textblock: Patients enrolled with a general practitioner clinic

clinical_study.official_title: Brugerbetaling i Almen Praksis (In Danish: User Charges for General Practitioner Services)

primary_outcome.description: Whether a patient accept a specified amount for a GP consultation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Diagnoses according to the Danish version of the International Classification of Primary Care (ICPC9

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
